case_vignette: A 5-year-old male is brought to his pediatrician after recurrent, prolonged upper respiratory infections over a period of several months. Physical exam reveals petechiae on the patient’s legs and arms. Laboratory studies show hemoglobin: 10 g/L, platelet count: 35,000/mm^3, leukocyte count: 6,600/mm^3. A bone marrow aspiration shows an abundance of lymphoblasts indicative of acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL).
question: Positive immunostaining for which  would support a diagnosis of precursor B-cell leukemia?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Hematology and Oncology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been getting lots of colds that seem to stick around for a long time.
Have you had any other symptoms such as fever, fatigue, or difficulty breathing?
Yes, I've been feeling tired more than usual.
Have you had any recent changes in your weight or appetite?
No, my weight and appetite have been pretty much the same.
Have you had any recent injuries or infections?
I've just had these colds that keep coming back.
Have you had any family members with similar symptoms?
No, it's just been me getting sick.
Have you had any recent changes in your lifestyle or habits?
No, nothing has changed in my routine or habits.
Have you had any recent travel or exposure to new environments?
No, I haven't traveled or been anywhere new.
Have you had any recent changes in your stress level or mental health?
No, my stress levels and how I feel inside have been normal.
Have you had any recent changes in your diet or exercise routine?
No, my eating and exercise have been the same as always.
Have you had any recent changes in your sleep patterns?
No, my sleep has been the same.
Have you had any recent changes in your medication or supplements?
No, I haven't started taking any new medicine or supplements.
Have you had any recent changes in your medical history or family history?
No changes in my health history or my family's.
Final Diagnosis: Chronic Fatigue Syndrome.
